text.title: Evaluate the Needs of a Senior

head.s: Evaluate the Needs of a Senior

p.s: Age progression generally brings forth various issues regarding physical health , mental health , mobility and daily living .
Seniors typically value their independence and believe they would become a burden to family and friends if they were no longer self-reliant .
Learning to evaluate the needs of a senior citizen can help ease transitions from living healthy and self-sufficient to assisted living or home care if help is needed .

item.s: Observe daily living and note any significant changes that may need to be addressed with your senior loved one .
Respect their independence by offering assistance with daily living objectives .

figure.rend: Evaluate the Needs of a Senior Step 1.jpg

item.s: Physical restrictions preparing meals or completing household tasks such as laundry .
Signs of neglect or elder abuse .
Maintaining schedule of medications .
Timeliness paying bills .
Keeping up with general appointments .
List possible needs for assistive technology that offers improved mobility , in addition to hearing and vision assistance .

figure.rend: Evaluate the Needs of a Senior Step 2.jpg

item.s: Wheelchair access will require home remodeling that may include installing a wheelchair access ramp or modifying a bathroom .
Upgrade land-line and cell phones with hearing enhancements or larger buttons .
Provide walking and seating aids when mobility becomes difficult due to arthritis , after an injury , surgical procedure or other condition .
Consider assistive technology options for reading such as an electronic reader , audio and Braille .
Evaluate health for physical and mental changes .
Becoming involved in your elder loved one 's health care can help them feel secure about challenges ahead .
Health and wellness is a critical area that may need the guidance of a medical professional .

figure.rend: Evaluate the Needs of a Senior Step 3.jpg

item.s: Assist in maintaining schedule of medications .
Supervise changes in medication or therapy .
Monitor significant shifts in mood such as extreme sadness , anger or irritability .
Notate changes or difficulty of mobility not observed previously .
Suggest group activities or therapy after the loss of a spouse .
Grief can go through stages that may include depression , withdrawal , guilt , blame and loss of appetite .

figure.rend: Evaluate the Needs of a Senior Step 4.jpg

item.s: Include your senior loved one in family activities and celebrations .
Encourage participation in senior citizen programs .
Recommend individual or group grief counseling .
Offer to listen whenever he or she would like to talk .
Note changes in the way business is handled .
Paying bills and completing tax returns may become difficult or forgotten .
Patterned behavior may be a sign that assistance is needed .

figure.rend: Evaluate the Needs of a Senior Step 5.jpg

item.s: Plan time to help with paying bills , grocery shopping or going to the bank .
Explain the risk of scams and how they can affect life .
Offer assistance with legal issues .
Record specific information when visiting your elder family member in a nursing facility .
Maintaining documentation of the living conditions , physical differences and personality changes may indicate signs of declining care or elder abuse .

figure.rend: Evaluate the Needs of a Senior Step 6.jpg

item.s: Is he happy to see you with open arms or a handshake ?
Is the living environment clean ?
Is your loved one clean and properly dressed ?
Are there any bruises , scratches or pressures sores on their body ?
Is communication with staff pleasant or hesitant ?
Contact your local Adult Protective Services ( APS ) if you believe you senior loved one is experiencing physical , emotional , sexual or financial abuse .
